answers.answer: Hi,How is your mother?  Telogen effluvium  is a type of hair loss that is usually due to a change in the normal hair cycle. It may occur when some type of shock ,  emotional or physical, causes hair roots to be pushed prematurely into the resting state. In a month or two, the hair follicles become active again and new hair starts to grow.  Hair typically grows back once the condition that caused it corrects itself, but it usually take months.Other causes of hair loss are: poor nutrition,  certain medications, hormonal changes, and medical conditions such as diabetes and lupus can also cause hair loss.Take care and regards.

question: My mother is 54 yrs old. About 6 months ago she noticed her hair was falling out.  Little by little the area became larger. Finally her hair is growing back but very slowly.  Her MD says its due to stress.  But in my opinion i think it is something else.  She looks like she has leukemia or something. But the rest of her hair is long as usual.  What can this be..? Lupus runs in our family as well as cancer.
title: Drastic Hairloss
